Text: I will praise You with all my heart; before the gods I will sing Your praises.
Context: David is expressing wholehearted gratitude and commitment to God, even in the presence of other so-called gods.

Text: I will bow down toward Your holy temple and give thanks to Your name for Your loving devotion and faithfulness, for You have exalted Your name and Your word above all things.
Context: David demonstrates humility and worships God, highlighting God’s steadfast love, trustworthiness, and the exaltation of His name and word.

Text: On the day I called, You answered me; You emboldened me and strengthened my soul.
Context: Here David recalls a personal experience of God‘s responsiveness and the inner strength he received from God during a time of need.

Text: All the kings of the earth will give You thanks, O LORD, when they hear the words of Your mouth.
Context: David expresses a hope or prophecy that world leaders will recognize and worship the Lord as they become aware of His words.

Text: They will sing of the ways of the LORD, for the glory of the LORD is great.
Context: This is a continuation of the previous sentiment, predicting that not only will kings give thanks, but also joyfully sing about the Lord’s ways.

Text: Though the LORD is on high, He attends to the lowly; but the proud He knows from afar.
Context: David contrasts God‘s treatment of the humble and the proud, emphasizing His care for the downtrodden and His distance from the haughty.

Text: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, You preserve my life; You stretch out Your hand against the wrath of my enemies, and Your right hand delivers me.
Context: David expresses trust in God’s protection and deliverance even when he is surrounded by danger.

Text: The LORD will fulfill His purpose for me. O LORD, Your loving devotion endures forever—do not abandon the works of Your hands.
Context: The psalm concludes with a declaration of confidence in God‘s faithfulness and a prayer for continued support, based on God’s enduring love.
